Today I welcome Molly Webster she has been an artist members since two thousand Fifteen and is a print maker and a mixed media artist at the current exhibition at the Sicilian Joyce and sewer Johnson gallery at Nineteen Washington street Mali
Is the spotlight solo artist the opening reception is friday October nineteenth from six to eight PM and her work will be on display until Saturday November third along with the exhibition titled
Off things great and small thank you for joining me today Molly thank you for inviting me less excited to be here so now Molly can you tell us when you first started making art so I really can't remember a time when I wasn't making art in some form during my life
Um search to create things has followed me from a young age and art education was always provided for me by my generous and creative parents
So I think by the time I got to high school I realize that art and art history we're always going to be defining elements to my personal an academic life and when I took a print making workshop at mass College of art back in my twenties I knew I had found my medium
That's great so interesting now Molly you have a long history on Nantucket your grandmother Gwen guy art owns the opera house restaurant so you must have had some very interesting visits to the island
Can you tell us what about the island inspires you need it took it is
Really um a place that's endlessly inspiring to me that holds the place in my memory it's filled with a really rich history goes stories famous vendors
And of course spectacular imagery to work with um kind of around every corner so I'm at the island culture and its community and the ecosystems here also fascinating places to study um and we're up to slow down a bit when we're here which allows for maybe more careful observation of our surroundings
Are well put so now Molly can you tell us about your work and your process
So typically I consider myself a polygraph print maker which means they use the collage image honest if not bored to make prints from and then make multiples of an image and then they layer other images on top of them for those who aren't familiar with the process I tell them it's like making a giant stamp on and after the prints are made
I occasionally and now more often than not well paint on top of the prints to add dimension um and the majority of my work in recent years is centered around the way human memory processes imagery I create semi has abducted shapes and forms a drop of memories of time spent near the ocean or on the beach wow
Well I Can't wait to see your new work and congratulations on your solo show can you tell us a little about what we'll see in the show so this show is
I'm going to be a jumping off point a combination of some new collage work where I Am taking prints and papers and re purpose thing my material to form abstract the geographic points on Nantucket
Um it's going to be a way that I'm sort of pushing my medium to make a change in my practice or because it's vital to to sort of keep that creative stamina going to try something different [noise]
Absolutely and so interesting well thank you so much for coming in today Molly thank you so much for having me join us for the artist association of Nantucket art talk
